revised_title: Diffraction by a Cylinder with a Variable Surface Impedance: A Perturbation Approach
tldr: The authors present a solution for the two-dimensional electromagnetic Green function for a circular cylinder with a peripherally varying surface impedance. They use a perturbation approach to analyze the diffraction of waves by the cylinder and provide a high-frequency asymptotic evaluation for plane wave incidence. The study explores the simultaneous influence of surface curvature and variability of surface properties on the high-frequency field diffracted by an object.
